headline: Baker Hughes says oil producers unlikely to increase spending this year
summary: U.S. oil and gas producers are unlikely to increase spending this year and output increases will primarily come from improved efficiencies rather than new drilling, Baker Hughes  Chief Executive Lorenzo Simonelli said on Monday.  The outlook comes as U.S. President Donald Trump's administration has repeatedly exhorted the industry to "Drill, baby, drill," to maximize oil and gas production and reduce consumer energy costs.  Still, oil prices have fallen this year and many producers remain focused on capital discipline over uninhibited drilling.

headline: Tariffs May Have Small Impact on Baker Hughes, CEO Says
summary: While new tariffs from the US could have a small impact on Baker Hughes, President Donald Trump has still ushered in a new era of energy renaissance in the US, according to CEO Lorenzo Simonelli....
